name: Build Help/Request 2H Human Ranger with Long Bow for Ranged Even a Viable Option for a PW?
author: stardog765

posts.author: stardog765
posts.content:
Hello all. I am pretty new here and just coming back to NWN after many years away so please forgive me if this ends up being a really dumb question/request.

A little background on the request. I am not a min/max kind of guy really so I have no doubt this type of build will NOT be some legendary butt kicker.  I do however prefer to play characters that I am interested in rather than just what works out to be the best technical build.  Basically what I am trying to find out is how viable would a build be that was a Human Ranger with studded leather or straight leather, one that is equally or close to equally proficient with a Long Bow at range as he is with a 2H sword of some kind up close.. I do understand you can't really have the best of both worlds so I know he wouldn't a master of either really but survivable on a PW like WoG, which is where I think I have decided I would like to play online at.  

Again I am just looking to see if he would be able to survive and if so if anyone has a good starting point as a build it would be very much appreciated.  I really do appreciate all the great posts here and thoughtful builds.

Thanks all.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi stardog. I can't promise much myself, but you might want to have a look at Valerfor's Classic Archer (Ranger 32/ Fighter 4/ Rogue 4) as a starter. It's an elf build, but perfectly do-able as human, which will, of course, get an extra feat. Now, it's a Dex build, so a 2-hander might not be the best idea, and if you wanted more than a WF in a melee weapon (from the extra feat), and you didn't mind sacrificing a Favoured Enemy or two, you could drop a few levels of Ranger for Fighter.

You can find the build via HipRedux's ECB Guild Filter, which you can get from the Rules and Tools sub-forum.

Just an opening thought for you.

posts.author: stardog765
posts.content: Stagmeister, thank you! I will see if I can find that.  I really do appreciate it.  Sounds like it at least might be do-able.

posts.author: stardog765
posts.content:
Ok ya I actually have been looking at that one.  I could get on board with Duel Wield. 

Thanks again.

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
There are ways.
I've made more than my share of rangers in my time. They work best when you know the place to play, because of favored enemies.

Ranger switch hitters, with light armour, might possibly work better when dual-wielding. I don't have access to my computer, but focusing on melee and going with the Arcane Archer should work good. It has been done before.

Ranger21 gets you Bane of Enemies. 23 gets you an extra Feat, same as 25 and 26. I would suggest 26, as 25 also improves Favored Enemy damage. Then 1 bard and perhaps as much as 13 Arcane Archer.

Elf, start with
STR 14
DEX 16
CON 12
INT 14
WIS 14
CHA 8

Boost strength at every turn. I will see what I can do when I get home.

Sent fra min SM-G950F via Tapatalk

posts.content: Thank you Grimnir, I really appreciate the feedback.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
AA is indeed the way to go if you want ranged AB in a strength based character.
Dex 16 and leather means you must buff dex to 18 to fill studded and 22 for regulær leather. AC is still not quite
par with full plate, but viable non the less. And Rangers can always grab a shield if need be.
